Command.Name: go
Command.Description: Delineates the end of a batch

Command.Name: go
Command.Description: Delineates the end of a batch and execute n times
Executes the following statement as an operating system command

Command.Name: Exit
Command.Description: Halt batch execution and return

Command.Name: :r
Command.Description: Read and execute the contents of a file containing a single batch

Command.Name: Setvar
Command.Description: Set the value of a scripting variable to NULL

Command.Name: Setvar
Command.Description: Set the value of a scripting variable

Command.Name: Error
Command.Description: Redirect error messages to a file

Command.Name: Error
Command.Description: Redirect error messages to standard error output

Command.Name: Error
Command.Description: Redirect error messages to standard output

Command.Name: Out
Command.Description: Redirect results to file

Command.Name: Out
Command.Description: Redirect results to standard output

Command.Name: Out
Command.Description: Redirect results to standard error output

Command.Name: Perftrace
Command.Description: Changes the destination for performance metrics to file

Command.Name: Perftrace
Command.Description: Changes the destination for performance metrics to standard error output

Command.Name: Perftrace
Command.Description: Changes the destination for performance metrics to standard output

Command.Name: Connect
Command.Description: Establish new connection and execute queries on that new connection

Command.Name: Connect
Command.Description: Establish new connection and execute queries on that new connection

Command.Name: Connect
Command.Description: Establish new connection and execute queries on that new connection

Command.Name: Connect
Command.Description: Establish new connection and execute queries on that new connection

Command.Name: On Error
Command.Description: Specifies what action to take upon encountering an error in the batch (exit)

Command.Name: On Error
Command.Description: Specifies what action to take upon encountering an error in the batch (ignore)

Command.Name: On Error
Command.Description: Specifies what action to take upon encountering an error in the batch (retry)

Command.Name: Include
Command.Description: Reads the contents of a file and executes all batches contained in the file
